image.altText: A Pacific worker throws a pumpkin onto a sorting line.

props.synopsis: The Australian Workers Union is calling for workers from the Pacific to be able to better access wages put away for their superannuation.

title.children: Union says super tax for PALM workers is preventing workers accessing their earnings

image.altText: A middle-aged man with dark hair takes a selfie among a crowd of people.

props.synopsis: Indonesia is one of Australia's biggest customers for wheat, red meat and live cattle but new president Prabowo Subianto wants the nation to be food self-sufficient within five years.

title.children: 'World's food barn': What does Indonesia's plan mean for Aussie farmers?

image.altText: The backs of a woman and a man looking at a body of water.

props.synopsis: A judge has handed down the largest fine ever under the NT’s sacred site laws after a sensitive men's site was damaged at Gunlom Falls in Kakadu National Park.

title.children: Gunlom Falls to reopen to tourists after historic fine handed down over sacred site damage

image.altText: A man stands on the bitumen with outback landscape behind him with a cowboy hat

props.synopsis: With the abortion debate making Queensland's election campaign national news, many Australians might be thinking 'cowboy' is a label applying to more than just supporters of the NRL team, writes Matt Eaton.

title.children: The beliefs of a man in a hat could have coloured how many Australians view life in Queensland

image.altText: A husband looks down at his wife who stares at the camera.

props.synopsis: Thai migrant Paphatsiri "Net" Woolcock has lived in a remote WA mining town for almost a decade and has two children, but has failed the test five times.

title.children: Australia's updated citizenship test is proving too hard for many — Net has failed it five times

image.altText: Six people wearing Australian branded green and white tracksuits smile at the camera. They all have gold medals on their necks.

props.synopsis: Australia's ninth placed finish on this year's Paralympic medal tally continued a downward trend since a table topping performance at Sydney 2000. But with increased funding and a home Games on the horizon, there is a path forward.

title.children: Can Australia re-establish itself as a Paralympic powerhouse?

image.altText: A smiling woman wears a thick black headband and floral jacket over a hot pink top

props.synopsis: Goorie author Melissa Lucashenko has won one of Australia's richest literary prizes, the ARA Historical Novel Prize, for Edenglassie, which interweaves stories of Aboriginal peoples in the past and present.

title.children: 'The country is changing': Melissa Lucashenko wins $100,000 literary prize for book about colonisation

image.altText: Young women's face with sunglasses on her head

props.synopsis: One in four women will experience pain during sex that can affect their self-worth and their relationships. These people say pelvis floor specialists can improve women's lives.

title.children: Sex was 'unbearable' for Daisy until she went to see a physiotherapist

image.altText: Two women with long blonde hair, smiling.

props.synopsis: Elle Macpherson went on Australian television and spoke about her holistic treatment to beat breast cancer. Behind the 'doctor' who helped her was a series of questionable qualifications.

title.children: 'Unbelievable': Oncologist questions claims of 'doctor' lauded by Elle Macpherson

image.altText: The king sits next to the Samoan prime minister, with the UK and Samoan flags behind them.

props.synopsis: The monarch will attend the Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting, where climate change will feature heavily, but Britain won't raise the issue of reparations for the empire's historic slavery practice.

title.children: King Charles lands in Samoa but Britain rules out raising slave-trade reparations at leaders' meeting

image.altText: A fireball and smoke erupt from a block of apartment buildings at night in a terrifying scene

props.synopsis: The Qatari media network called the Israeli claims against six of its Palestinian journalists an attempt to "silence" their reporting on the war.

title.children: Israel strikes Beirut as Al Jazeera rejects claims of journalists working for Hamas

image.altText: Donald Trump sits at a table with a microphone in front of him. A sign behind him says 'Trump'.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump prefers the "dictator approach" to running a country, and openly wished he had "Hitler's generals" when he was US president, his former White House chief of staff says.

title.children: Donald Trump meets the definition of a fascist, his former chief of staff says

image.altText: Two cardboard boxes labelled MEMPHIS 100 menthol tubes sit on a table, cigarettes unpacked on top

props.synopsis: New South Wales will unveil long-awaited changes today in a bid to penalise tobacconists selling illegal cigarettes and crack down on the growing black market.

title.children: There's a reason so many dodgy tobacco shops are popping up across NSW — this is the plan to fix it

image.altText: A woman holds a sign at a Brisbane pro-choice rally in May.

props.synopsis: Meanwhile research published by the Society of Family Planning has found abortion rates have stayed the same overall, despite an outright ban in some states.

title.children: Infant mortality increases by 7 per cent in the US following removal of abortion as constitutional right

image.altText: Geoff Capes with a budgerigar balancing on his bicep

props.synopsis: Geoff Capes, who twice won the World's Strongest Man in the 1980s and competed at three Olympic Games, as well as being a renowned breeder of budgerigars, has died aged 75.

title.children: Two-time World's Strongest Man, Olympian and budgerigar breeder, Geoff Capes dies

image.altText: Metallica (L-R: Kirk Hammett, Lars Ulrich, James Hetfield, Robert Trujillo) performing live in Detroit on the M72 tour.

props.synopsis: The metal icons touch down in November, 2025 to headline stadium shows with support from Evanescene and Suicidal Tendencies.

title.children: Metallica return to Australia for first tour in 12 years

image.altText: a house for sale in the brisbane suburb of stafford with the sale sign in the front yard

props.synopsis: Wall Street has suffered losses overnight, as worries that interest rates will stay higher for longer weigh on investors. Australian share might follow with muted trade. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Australia's bank lobby says home loan buffer could be 'more flexible' for first home buyers

image.altText: The exterior of Perth Airport's train station in the foreground with the air traffic control tower in the background.

props.synopsis: Liberal MP David Honey is raising the alarm about Perth Airport's free wi-fi policy, saying it's an invasion of privacy — and a digital rights expert agrees. But the airport says the terms and conditions are standard.

title.children: 'Profoundly offensive': MP hits out at Perth Airport wi-fi terms, but airport says they are 'standard'

image.altText: North Korean troops on a TV screen, dressed in olive  green military attire holding guns.

props.synopsis: US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin says the deployment is very serious and warned the forces will be 'fair game' if they go into combat against Ukraine on behalf of Russia.

title.children: US confirms 3,000 North Korean troops sent to Russia

image.altText: Hainsworth interview

props.synopsis: Steven Hainsworth was arrested in 2019, 21 years after allegedly murdering the first of three victims. He has spent the past two months listening intently to evidence from the Supreme Court dock.

title.children: An accused serial killer was arrested 21 years after allegedly murdering his first victim. This is how his trial has unfolded

image.altText: A handful of Ord River chickpeas over the grading machine

props.synopsis: Pressure is mounting to get Australia's chickpea harvest into India before taxes that could cost exporters more than half their profit kick back in.

title.children: Farmers race to get chickpeas from Australian paddocks to India as tariff deadline looms

image.altText: A 15-year-old girl sitting on a couch and looking at her phone.

props.synopsis: The federal government's proposed social media ban is likely to be detrimental to some teens, particularly for young people in isolated and marginalised communities, experts and teenagers say.

title.children: Why the proposed social media ban could do more harm than good

image.altText: Newly built homes in a housing estate

props.synopsis: The state's building regulator has been exposed for failing to hold builders to account, prompting the government to replace the VBA with a new regulator with greater powers.

title.children: A new watchdog with greater powers will replace the Victorian Building Authority following a damning review

image.altText: An artist's impression of a black hole drawing material off a nearby star. A second star is in the background.

props.synopsis: A system called V404 Cygni was thought to be a black hole and a companion star, but another star billions of kilometres away was also found gravitationally connected to the duo.

title.children: First 'black hole triple system' discovered by astronomers

image.altText: A grey mouse in a plastic bucket with its face in a spiky stubby banksia flower.

props.synopsis: Flowers can be pollinated in a multitude of ways, and now a series of studies is showing just how big a role rats and mice play when it comes to Australian flora.

title.children: Native and introduced mice are quietly pollinating Australian plants, study shows

image.altText: Apollo Quiboloy sits in a black jumper with short black hair looking seriously at the camera

props.synopsis: Police investigating Apollo Quiboloy told senators that up to 200 women may have been victimised by him over many years.

title.children: Appointed son of God' denies sexually assaulting followers of his church

image.altText: Bullet holes are seen on the front of a Toyota minibus

props.synopsis: Residents of Papua New Guinea's Enga province say they're fearful a "new brand of tribal warfare" has started after gunmen stormed a passenger bus, killing at least six people.

title.children: Seven dead after gunmen ambush public bus in Papua New Guinea and trigger 'new brand' of tribal violence

image.altText: Steve Smith and Usman Khawaja wait to bat during training

props.synopsis: Each of the leading contenders to partner Usman Khawaja at the top of Australia's Test order has struggled to find consistent form this summer, and it is symbolic of a generation of cricketers yet to hit their straps.

title.children: Australia can't find a long term replacement for Warner, and it is a sign of things to come for our ageing Test side

image.altText: Erling Haaland grimaces

props.synopsis: Erling Haaland scored a goal his manager Pep Guardiola could only describe as "unbelievable" as Manchester City broke a Champions League record and extended a stunning start for English clubs in the competition.

title.children: Haaland's 'freak' finish caps extraordinary Champions League night for English clubs

image.altText: Explorer Jill Heinerth

props.synopsis: Diving through narrow crevices underwater on limited amounts of air may not appeal to everyone, but cave diver Jill Heinerth wants more people to tap into their inner explorer.

title.children: 'I swim through the graves of my friends': Why this cave diver takes great risks to explore the unknown

image.altText: A woman looks into a man's eyes with one hand on his head and the other on his shoulder.

props.synopsis: He Ain't Heavy is the result of Perth filmmaker David Vincent Smith mining the trauma of his brother's substance-use issues for his first feature.

title.children: How far would you go to save your brother from addiction? This moving WA film explores the extremes

image.altText: Commonwealth Games Australia boss Craig Phillips

props.synopsis: Craig Phillips has fired another shot at the Victorian government, claiming Commonwealth Games Australia never had a chance to present the 10-sport version of the event heading to Glasgow.

title.children: Commonwealth Games Australia boss fires latest shot at Victoria, says state could have 'absolutely' hosted streamlined event

image.altText: Household money pic

props.synopsis: The IMF's revised forecasts for Australian inflation now match the Reserve Bank's forecasts. Is that a story?

title.children: Stop the presses! The IMF's forecasts for Australia's inflation now match the Reserve Bank's

image.altText: A woman in a red jumper smiles while holding a certificate against a wall of certificates

props.synopsis: The night Gwenda Allgood told her husband she was considering running for local council, she slept in her son's bedroom. She refused to leave until her husband gave her his support.

title.children: Victoria's longest serving female councillor retires after 42 years
